website_summaries.verdict: The expensive Beyerdynamic Amiron Home headphones deliver powerful sub-bass and detailed highs with superb accuracy.
pros: Fantastic, accurate sonic performance with excellent bass depth and superb clarity and detail in the highs
Open design lends a greater sense of space

customer_reviews.title: Solid
customer_reviews.text: From the moment I picked these up from the box I realised that this may be my last pair of headphones. I probably wouldn't need anything better. I'm not expert at headphones but I decided to treat myself after owning a pair of hd 598s for just over 3 years. What an upgrade. The sound is so much warmer and less fatiguing to listen to. The build quality is what you'd expect from German made headphones. I just can't recommend these enough. If you are considering picking these up, I highly suggest that you just get them. A great investment that will last you for years to come. Glad I jumped off the Sennheiser bandwagon to try something different
customer_reviews.author: Benjamin

customer_reviews.title: highly recommended
customer_reviews.text: As mentioned in a previous review, I purchased these as upgrade to a pair of Grado's 325I's. The Grado's were great with certain types of music but the treble became harsh and incoherent when music would get complex and loud. That problem completely disappears with the Amiron's. They can handle anything thrown at them and retain clarity in the treble and the low end. The jump from a £300 pair of headphones to a £500 pair is definitely easy to hear and worth it.
customer_reviews.author: matthew codd

customer_reviews.title: Perhaps with a revision these could be superb headphones.
customer_reviews.text: Really wanted to like these - They look great, feel pretty comfortable, and the price is reasonable. However (used with a Chord Hugo TT DAC as source) I was immediately aware of an unnaturally brightly lit sound. Not balanced sounding at all. Very forceful and ‘shouty’ in presentation. Just couldn’t relax with them. Ideal however if you like a very fast, punchy bass and dynamic presentation. Not a good allrounder, but probably ideal for Metal and Thrash etc. These could have been something very special if the sound was better balanced. Perhaps if there’s ever a Mk2 these might be worth another audition.
customer_reviews.author: J. MAY

customer_reviews.title: Perfect pair for home listening.
customer_reviews.text: Purchased these headphones to compliment a Schiit Audio Lyr 3 DAC/Amp; to use as my daily drivers while at my desk. In brief: Absolutely faultless. The headphones are exceedingly comfortable (I happen to be exactly a setting 3, so perhaps if you’re caught between headband settings it could be a little less so), to the degree that you almost forget to wear them. The included cable is about a mile long, so I have swapped that out for a shorter one that’s a bit more practical. Sound quality is phenomenal as you would expect for the price tag.
customer_reviews.author: Angus M

customer_reviews.title: beautiful
customer_reviews.text: Great sound and sooo comfortable. I moved up from AKGs, which I was very happy with, and I have to say I did not know what I was missing. Living in a terraced house these cans are a wonderful sub for my BnW speakers.
customer_reviews.author: Ian B

customer_reviews.title: Rediscovering Music!
customer_reviews.text: Extremely good open-ear headphones with a spacious sound and fantastic quality. Also very comfortable and not too heavy, however the audio cord (3m) is too long to use the headphones in conjunction with anything other than a hifi.
customer_reviews.author: Matt

customer_reviews.title: They leak sound so not good for commuting
customer_reviews.text: These headphones are very comfortable to wear. Soundwise they are detailed,dynamic and require a good DAC or headphone amp to get the best out of them.
customer_reviews.author: Robin

customer_reviews.title: Probably the best headphone I've bought
customer_reviews.text: This Beyerdynamic Amiron Home High-End Stereo Headphone is probably the best headphone I've bought. The sound quality is brilliant and it fits comfortably. It would be great if the next model could be a bit lighter.
customer_reviews.author: Koko

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable to listen to for long periods of time
customer_reviews.text: I am using these with a beyerdynamic a 20 headphone amp they are comfortable to ware for long periods of time and the sound is very clear with good treble midrange and bass i could highly recommend these headphones
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Sound Quality
customer_reviews.text: Excellent sound quality for listening primarily to jazz- bright highs and resonnant base (not too boomy). Also very comfortable to wear.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. N. A. B. Taylor

customer_reviews.title: Good for multi genres.
customer_reviews.text: Wonderful clear sound. Full bodied too with a touch of warmth and a wide soundstage. Very comfortable.
customer_reviews.author: mvu

customer_reviews.title: Amazing quality and value - buy these!
customer_reviews.text: I listen to Tidal with these and a Dragonfly Cobalt DAC. My advice - get both! Astounding sound quality for the money.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew Howard

customer_reviews.title: Great buy
customer_reviews.text: I bought these to replace my Grado 325, which are very good headphones. But these are just so much better in ever department.
customer_reviews.author: William Driver

customer_reviews.title: beyerdynamic Amiron home high-end stereo headphones.
customer_reviews.text: Sent these back as I noticed clipping at normal volumes and out of curiousity, when turned up slightly louder, severe distortion. Could not wwork out words or music as it was so bad. Played through an Astell&Kern music player using high quality recordings. Comfort wise, these are a delight, fully over ear, just the right pressure. Have to assume that I have been unlucky quality wise,as I was sad to have to return these.
customer_reviews.author: paddyoreilly

product_meta.title: beyerdynamic Amiron Home High-End Stereo Headphone
product_meta.description:
Style Name:HomeAmiron home is an open designed stereo headphone and therefore ideal for music enjoyment at home. Due to the open design Amiron home turns the living room into a concert stage and fascinates through an excellent accuracy in detail. Due to the optimised Tesla technology Amiron home provides an even more precise sound tuning. The use of high-quality materials such as Alcantara microfibre and microvelour ensures ear and headband pads as soft as velvet and contributes to a good feeling when listening to music. As all high end headphones from beyerdynamic Amiron home is “handmade in Germany”.

BOX CONTAINS
Beyerdynamic Amiron Home Headphones
Carry Case
1.3m Straight Cable with 3.5mm jack plug
feature_bullets: Open, high-end over-ear headphones for an authentic concert experience at home. Nominal sound pressure level- 102 dB (1 mW / 500 Hz)
The improved and optimised Tesla technology guarantees a listening experience that's in a class of its own
Precise and clear resolution makes the Amiron home a musical talent for the most varied music genres
High-quality materials ensure optimum wearing comfort, even when enjoying music for several hours
Made in Germany offers the promise of durability and optimum quality. Headphone frequency response 5 to 40,000 Hertz and Nominal Impedance Headphones 250 ohms
